thread.title: Trinity football worn down on the road
thread.title_full: Trinity football worn down on the road

author: Dan Agnew
title: Trinity football worn down on the road
text:
Trinity football worn down on the road Injury-depleted Knights can’t match up against bigger Mary Star of the Sea Posted: October 23, 2015 11:00   23, 2015 11:25 p.m. A A A 
The long season is starting to wear on Trinity Classical Academy football. 
A team that began its first 11-man football season with 21 players on the roster came into Friday night’s game with just 14 healthy players. 
And going against a much bigger opponent, the Knights lost 48-14 against Mary Star of the Sea at Daniels Field in San Pedro. 
After scoring on its opening drive to take an 8-0 lead, Trinity’s Tyler Lee threw four first-half interceptions that helped Mary Star take control 46-8 at the half. 
Lee finished 7-of-13 passing for 105 yards, a touchdown pass and the four picks. His one scoring pass went to Caden Kulp, who finished with five catches for 77 yards and carried the ball 13 times for 94 yards. 
Trinity (4-3) turned to Kulp and the running game in the second half, which is partly why it was able to outscore the Stars (5-3) after the break. 
The Knights scored the only touchdown of the second half on an Ian Caddow 5-yard run. 
“The future is going to be bright. We’ve got a good group of warriors. If we play like we play, you see what you have on the inside,” said Trinity head coach Les Robinson of his team’s fight in the second half.
